intro: Clematis smilacina, commonly known as the vine clematis, is a deciduous climbing vine native to eastern North America. It features compound leaves with three to five leaflets and produces fragrant, white or pale blue flowers in late spring to early summer. The plant has a woody stem covered in persistent, brownish-yellow bark and can grow up to 20 feet in length. It thrives in partial shade to full sun and prefers moist, well-drained soil. Clematis smilacina is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to climb trellises or walls.
